channel.title: Teardrop blade
channel.description:
I call it, the teardrop blade. My latest model, took about 50 minutes. Rather pleased, rate/hate. Please, don't flame or troll this. If you can do better, good for you. And if you CAN do better (as in proof) good for you. I'm doing this with a shitty program. And just because you're better at something doesn't mean you can tell other people they suck, because I'm sure 85% of people would have no idea what they're doing if they touch a program like this.
[IMG]http://i33.tinypic.com/f9imq8.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i35.tinypic.com/nwkifd.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i36.tinypic.com/2rhqkhk.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i36.tinypic.com/1fz6vo.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i35.tinypic.com/aomh6e.jpg[/img]

item.title: Teardrop blade
item.dc:creator: @liam_2kill liam 2kill
item.description:
@liam_2kill wrote:

I’d say more of a ice blade.

Read full topic

item.title: Teardrop blade
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Actually, I was thinking two seperate items: the sheathe and the sword. The sheathe could be worn normally in the cape slot, and the sword in the weapons slot. Then you could use them on each other to have the sword in the sheathe, and wear that as a cape. I use 317 servers for the most part, so I have never used the ‘Operate’ feature, which is why I was thinking of adding some right-click choice to take the sword out.

Read full topic

item.title: Teardrop blade
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:19, topic:354854”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=451423.msg3309566#msg3309566 date=1281891958]

this looks VERY good i really like it… release???

If enough people want it, I guess. Anyone else want this model for there server?
[/quote]Well I could release it for you if you’d like. I generally don’t run my server, but its nice nonetheless

EDIT: Oh yea, I could make it useable on the sheathe so you can wear it like a cape Then you can take it out and still use the sheathe Now if only I knew how to add a feature like that …[/quote]

Make a cape model and a weapon model.
Then, as of roughly runescape servers 377+, right clicking on a model gave you the option to “operate” it. When operating the cape, it turns into the sword, and when operating the sword, it becomes the cape again.

Read full topic

EDIT: Oh yea, I could make it useable on the sheathe so you can wear it like a cape Then you can take it out and still use the sheathe Now if only I knew how to add a feature like that …

item.description:

Eh, I’m only good with making some things in Blender, so I might be using Meta here and there (Mainly because I don’t know how to rotate something by exact angles, like 90 degrees <.<)

item.title: Teardrop blade
item.dc:creator: @0bbyme 0bbyme
item.description:
@0bbyme wrote:

[quote=“dylan_0789, post:14, topic:354854”]Great model. The simplicity makes this suited for Runescape. 0bby, I’m going to have to disagree with you as ingame, the added detail you have explained would be so tiny that it would actually ruin the model ingame.

Offtopic: Why is everyone switching over to Blender? :P[/quote]
haha no clue. and i guess it wouldn’t really matter in a runescape client lol but for 3d modeling its always great to have the added detail

Read full topic

item.title: Teardrop blade
item.dc:creator: @0bbyme 0bbyme
item.description:
@0bbyme wrote:

idk the hilt just doesnt have that much personality. like for example instead of just adding a bold saphire why not add a holder on it like this? it is the extra detail that will make your models look better

Read full topic

item.title: Teardrop blade
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

0bbyme:

well it might just be me but when i think of a water fantasy weapon i think of decorative like streams around the hilt. it just seems a little to bland you need to spice it up

What if I added like a dark blue sapphire?
Edit: here pics

Read full topic

item.title: Teardrop blade
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:7, topic:354854”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=451423.msg3308806#msg3308806 date=1281836180]

Good, But try not to just slap primitaves together. Make sure the areas are connected where they need to be.

I thought everything fit nicely together. What do you mean by “slapped together”
[/quote]He means like they were simply moved into place and the points/edges weren’t joined.[/quote]
Oh ok. Yea, I do that.
How can i not do that?

Read full topic
